result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Markie R. Geske

records.addlTxt:
Proposed Order to Withdraw - Declined.
Per the Court: The request to withdraw will be granted, if granted at all, following a hearing on the issue. Please schedule.

10:14 AM case called. Prosecuting Attorney Robert W. Stoiber in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Markie R. Geske in court with Attorney Roger M Hillestad. Attorney Hilestad states there is no agreement at this time. Defense continues to waive times limits and requests a preliminary hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on December 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Case called at 9:57 AM. 
Defendant Markie R. Geske not in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Markie R. Geske.  Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Hillestad has no information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. 
State requests warrant and notes the Defendant was present when this date/time was scheduled. Warrant ordered.
Case re-called at 10:13 AM.
Defendant Markie R. Geske in court without Attorney Hillestad. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrant quashed.
RTN: 10/18/22 at 9:30 AM.
Hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
